image.altText: Peter Malinauskas speaking and gesturing his hand on stage to a crowd

props.synopsis: South Australian voters resonated with Labor's pledge to "fix the ramping crisis", among other promises, but could it come back to bite them in next year's election? State political reporter Leah MacLennan explains.

title.children: Is the SA government on track to meet all its promises?

image.altText: A beach with a dune and ocean

props.synopsis: An Eyre Peninsula community reeling from two fatal shark attacks in 15 months is concerned that recreational fishing and cage diving could be attracting sharks to the area.

title.children: Fishing restrictions considered after report examining fatal SA shark attacks

image.altText: A man in a suit walks down court steps in front of other people

props.synopsis: A man who pretended to be a nurse at one of Adelaide's major hospitals has shown "limited insight" into his offending and has a "narcissistic component" to his personality, a court hears.

title.children: Nurse impersonator's apology leaves magistrate 'somewhat troubled'

image.altText: Soursob Bob at Milledge's Distillation

props.synopsis: Milledge's Distillation in the heart of Port Adelaide's commercial district is being taken to court by the local council over what its owners say is a lone noise complaint. Â

title.children: Popular Adelaide music venue fears closure over single noise complaint

image.altText: A man wearing a T-shirt crossing his arms in front of a bay with seaweed and cliffs

props.synopsis: Similar seawater quality problems to those that have been reported near Victor Harbor are threatening the livelihood of a fisher in the state's south-east.

title.children: SA fisher says 'burning' water harming marine life and business

image.altText: A woman with a tube in her nose and in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: SA women with endometriosis are experiencing long delays in diagnosis and treatment because of problems accessing medical services, as well as a lack of awareness, a parliamentary inquiry finds.

title.children: Endometriosis sufferers experiencing delays in SA for treatment and diagnosis

image.altText: A smiling woman wearing a yellow top stands in front of a field of yellow flowers

props.synopsis: A mother charged with the attempted murder of her two sons after stabbing them multiple times on an Adelaide motorway has been found not guilty by way of mental incompetence.

title.children: Mother who stabbed her two sons found not guilty by way of mental incompetence

image.altText: James Bull with his hand in the air as he does a DJ set

props.synopsis: People with disabilities are sometimes turned away from regular nightclubs, where they can be falsely accused of being drunk or made uncomfortable by strobe lighting â but The Heart Beat Club is run by DJs with disabilities, for people with disabilities.

title.children: DJs to spin their way into hearts of Fringe-goers on disability club night

image.altText: A firefighting volunteer wearing a fedora hat

props.synopsis: Volunteer firefighters and their support staff have travelled more than 1,000 kilometres to help small towns fighting fires in South Australia's south-east.

title.children: Tents, mates, and big breakfasts for travelling volunteers helping firies

image.altText: A state MP surrounded by journalists outside court.

props.synopsis: Fraud and theft offending by a South Australian MP was fuelled by "greed" and has so far cost him his family home and more than $800,000 in legal fees, a court hears.

title.children: Fraudster MP who stole more than $430k motivated by 'greed', court told

image.altText: Three young children jumping in a puddle on an otherwise dry ground with a tractor in the background

props.synopsis: Many South Australians awoke to the almost unfamiliar sound of rain hitting their roofs as parts of Adelaide experienced falls of 10mm, and the state's west recorded even higher totals.

title.children: Adelaide welcomes wettest weather in more than 100 days amid SA rain

image.altText: A view of the Royal Adelaide Hospital.

props.synopsis: Doctors and nurses say patient care could be compromised if the SA government pushes ahead with plans to shift the infectious diseases unit out of Adelaideâs biggest public hospital and move it to a site across the road.

title.children: Hospital 'Tetris puzzle' could put SA patients at risk, tribunal hears

image.altText: A man stands in front of a white wall in american prison

props.synopsis: Former Adelaide megachurch pastor Daniel Menelaou, who was last week charged in the US with possession of child sexual abuse material, has been banned from working with children in SA.

title.children: Pastor arrested in US for alleged abuse banned from working with children

image.altText: Trucks and car travelling along a major road

props.synopsis: Community calls for a full duplication of the Sturt Highway have been back by South Australia's peak motoring body, which says planning needs to start now for the project to be realised.

title.children: Business owner's pre-election plea for highway duplication and safety

image.altText: Garry Davis in a police interview room

props.synopsis: For months, I've spent my Saturdays speaking with a convicted killer, writes Anne Connolly. He says he's innocent, others fear he's guilty of even more.

title.children: What I learnt from four months' conversations with a killer

image.altText: Lilie James, whoÂ was killed atÂ St Andrew's Cathedral School in Sydney's CBD on October 25, 2023, smiling in an undated selfie

props.synopsis: The man who murdered Lilie James was meticulous, calculated and calm. This was not a momentary loss of control, he knew what he was doing, an inquest into her death was told this week.

title.children: Friends mistook it as love. But Lilie James's killer was controlling

image.altText: David Shoebridge wearing a navy suit jacket and white shirt.

props.synopsis: Australian industry would receive $4 billion to manufacture drones and missiles under a new Greens party policy, which would come from scrapping billions of dollars in US contracts.

title.children: Greens promise $4b for 'self-defence' missiles in first defence spending policy

image.altText: Woman in red smiles at camera.

props.synopsis: The Coalition has vowed to cut waste from the government bureaucracy after criticising Labor for growing the public sector.Â

title.children: Productivity boss warns cutting public service won't save much money

image.altText: A blurry screengrab captures Elon Musk and and U.S. Defence Secretary Pete Hegseth laughing

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says war plans should not be shared with his billionaire adviser Elon Musk because of his business interests.

title.children: Musk can't access China war plans, Trump says amid Pentagon visit

image.altText: An illustration with clouds in-filled with the Australian, UK and US flags

props.synopsis: Can Australia still trust the United States as an ally? Does Donald Trump even know what AUKUS is? These are your questions about the AUKUS trilateral security deal.

title.children: The looming election has put a spotlight on AUKUS and the US alliance

image.altText: Na-Yeon makes a peace sign with her right hand as she leans and poses for a photograph that's been printed onto a square block.

props.synopsis: As AI technology rapidly improves, some people in South Korea talk with computer-generated models of their dead loved ones to process grief and say goodbye.Â

title.children: 'My heart became lighter': AI gave this grieving mum a final farewell

image.altText: Israeli Defence Minister Israel Katz in a suit

props.synopsis: Israel's Defence Minister Israel Katz says he has ordered troops to go deeper into the Gaza Strip, vowing they would hold land until Hamas release hostages still captive.Â

title.children: Israel orders troops to 'seize more territory' in Gaza

image.altText: A massive ball of flames and smoke rises from an electrical substation at night

props.synopsis: Hundreds of thousands of people have been grappling with up-ended travel plans after Europe's busiest airport was closed after losing power due to a fire.

title.children: Heathrow flights to resume as police probe 'catastrophic' fire that cut power

image.altText: Close up of shopping trolley in supermarket aisle

props.synopsis: The "gamification" of supermarket loyalty programs could be influencing customers without them realising, according to the ACCC inquiry.

title.children: Your supermarket points program may influence you more than you realise

image.altText: For sale sign on Queenslander-style house that needs renovating in a street in Brisbane.

props.synopsis: Income and property price caps for the housing scheme are set to rise as part of next week's federal budget.

title.children: Labor to lift income and property price caps on 'Help to Buy' scheme

image.altText: A woman in a suit addresses a media conference, a man stands in the background.

props.synopsis: A workplace dispute between Deputy Prime Minister Richard Marles and his former chief of staff has been settled, months after she alleged she was pushed out of her job for raising a bullying complaint against colleagues in the office.Â

title.children: Deputy PM's former chief of staff settles legal dispute with government

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: Lachlan Kennedy, Jeremiah Azu, of Great Britain and Akani Simbine at the World Indoor Athletics Championships.

props.synopsis: Lachlan Kennedy reaches the podium after finishing second in the men's 60 metres final at the World Athletics Indoor Championships in China.

title.children: Aussie sprinter Kennedy wins historic silver at world indoor titles

image.altText: Colourful picture with a shadowy figure on a horse against rolling hills

props.synopsis: Sam Poo was executed in October 1865 for murdering Senior Constable John Ward, but academic Meg Foster has doubts about the evidence for this crime. Â Â

title.children: Did this Chinese bushranger really kill a policeman? Here's what we know

image.altText: Steele Sidebottom and Scott Pendlebury clap the Magpies fans at the MCG.

props.synopsis: Despite some nervous moments, Collingwood coach Criag McRae is pleased with how his side is tracking after edging the Western Bulldogs by six points in an MCG thriller.

title.children: McRae satisfied with 'new version' of Magpies after tight win over Bulldogs

image.altText: A woman does a cartwheel on a football field.

props.synopsis: The Fremantle Dockers star has found a force in having ADHD, especially on the football field. Can having neurodivergent traits like hyper-focus give athletes a real advantage?Â

title.children: AFLW player Emma O'Driscoll on using ADHD to her benefit

image.altText: Diana Reid, a young woman with long brown hair, wearing a grey patterned blazer and white T-shirt

props.synopsis: Diana Reid, author of bestseller Love and Virtue, subverts the traditional trauma plot in a new summer noir thriller, Signs of Damage.

title.children: Author says her White-Lotus-style novel subverts a literary trend

image.altText: Man wearing sunglasses holding up dead rat

props.synopsis: A bin strike in Birmingham has resulted in rubbish piling up in the streets and sparked warnings about "rats the size of cats", with residents claiming the rodents are "just everywhere".Â

title.children: Rubbish piles up in Birmingham with 'rats the size of cats', residents say

image.altText: A photo of a scorched sign on a building reading 'pulse'.

props.synopsis: Thirteen people including a former government minister have been arrested in North Macedonia on Friday over a nightclub blaze that killed 59 people including six minors.

title.children: Thirteen arrested over North Macedonia nightclub fire which killed 59

image.altText: Mariah Carey performs in Times Square

props.synopsis: A lawsuit claiming All I Want For Christmas Is You infringed the copyright of an earlier song with the same title is dismissed without trial.

title.children: 'No evidentiary support': US judge rules Mariah Carey did not steal most famous song
